action.action-desc: Ms. Maxine Waters of California (for herself, Mr. Evans, Mrs. Beatty, Mr. Sean Patrick Maloney of New York, and Mr. Payne) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to codify the authority of the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to assign a disability rating of total to a veteran by reason of unemployability, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Protecting Benefits for Disabled Veterans Act of 2017.

subsection.text: Chapter 11 of title 38, United States Code, is amended by inserting after section 1163 the following:

section.header: Determination of total disability by reason of unemployability

subsection.text: Subject to subsection (b), for the purposes of this chapter, in the case of a veteran who has a service-connected disability, or service-connected disabilities, not rated as total, the Secretary may assign a disability rating of total to the veteran if the Secretary determines the veteran—

paragraph.text: is unable to secure or maintain substantially gainful employment as a result of, in part or in whole, a service-connected disability; and

subparagraph.text: a service-connected disability rated at least 60 percent; or

clause.text: at least one of which is rated at least 40 percent; and
that, combined, are rated at least 70 percent.

subsection.header: Additional authority of the Secretary To assign a disability rating of total
subsection.text: The Secretary may assign a disability rating of total to a veteran who has a service-connected disability or disabilities described in subsection (a)(2)—

paragraph.text: if the veteran maintains marginal employment; or

subparagraph.text: the veteran maintains substantially gainful employment; and

the Secretary, considering the totality of circumstances (including total household medical expenses and the cost of living in the area in which the veteran resides), determines that such assignation is appropriate.

subsection.header: Prohibition on the consideration of certain factors
subsection.text: In making any determination under subsection (a) or (b), the Secretary may not consider the following:

paragraph.text: The eligibility of a veteran for any retirement benefit, including any benefit under title II of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 401 et seq.).

The term marginal employment means employment for which the earned annual income is less than 100 percent of the official poverty threshold for an individual established by the United States Census Bureau.

The term substantially gainful employment means employment for which the earned annual income equals or exceeds 100 percent of the official poverty threshold for an individual established by the United States Census Bureau.

subsection.text: The table of sections at the beginning of chapter 11 of title 38, United States Code, is amended by adding after the item relating to section 1163 the following:

toc.toc-entry: 1164. Determination of total disability by reason of unemployability.

subsection.text: Not later than 180 days after the effective date of this Act, the Secretary of Veterans Affairs shall prescribe such regulations as may be necessary to carry out this section.
